definition: earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
Tudi Gong, the God of the earth
Lei Gong or Duke of Thunder, the God of Thunder in Chinese mythology
to offer sacrifices to the gods or ancestors
exorcising God/God who drives away plague and evil spirits
five chief demons of folklore personifying pestilence/cf four horsemen of the apocalypse
the five regions: the east, south, west, north and center/all parts/China and the lands beyond its frontiers

four divinities/four divine emperors/four mythical creatures symbolic of prosperity and longevity, namely the phoenix 鳳|凤[feng4], turtle 龜|龟[gui1], dragon 龍|龙[long2] and Chinese unicorn 麒麟[qi2 lin2]/also 四象[si4 xiang4], the four division of the sky
to offer sacrifices to the gods
